name: ax-hgprmladder
params: setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2
body: |- wrex(s0, cfv(cuz, nat3), wrex(s1, cfv(ciccp, cv(s0)), wa(w3a(wceq(cfv(cv(s1), nat0), nat7), wceq(cfv(cv(s1), nat1), cdc(nat1, nat3)), wceq(cfv(cv(s1), cv(s0)), co(cdc(nat8, nat9), cmul, co(cdc(nat1, nat0), cexp, cdc(nat2, nat9))))), wral(s2, co(nat0, cfzo, cv(s0)), w3a(wcel(cfv(cv(s1), cv(s2)), cdif(cprime, csn(nat2))), wbr(co(cfv(cv(s1), co(cv(s2), caddc, nat1)), cmin, cfv(cv(s1), cv(s2))), clt, co(co(nat4, cmul, co(cdc(nat1, nat0), cexp, cdc(nat1, nat8))), cmin, nat4)), wbr(nat4, clt, co(cfv(cv(s1), co(cv(s2), caddc, nat1)), cmin, cfv(cv(s1), cv(s2)))))))))
comment: There is a partition ("ladder") of primes from 7 to 8.8 x 10^30 with parts ("rungs") having lengths of at least 4 and at most N - 4, see section 1.2.2 in [Helfgott] p. 4. Temporarily provided as "axiom". (Contributed by AV, 3-Aug-2020.) (Revised by AV, 9-Sep-2021.)
